thread.title: ‘I don’t know about dudes because I’m not one’
thread.title_full: ‘I don’t know about dudes because I’m not one’

title: ‘I don’t know about dudes because I’m not one’
text:
Anne Hathaway talks about The Intern, marriage, technology and multi-tasking Michele Manelis news.com.au Anne Hathaway talks about The Intern, marriage, technology and multi-tasking Michele Manelis news.com.au Film Trailer: 'The Intern' 2:18 
Watch the film trailer for "The Intern," starring Robert De Niro, Anne Hathaway and Rene Russo. Photo: Warner Bros. September 18th 2015 19 days ago /video/video.news.com.au/Entertainment/ 
Anne Hathaway may be playing the quintessential tech-savvy millennial in upcoming movie, The Intern, but she admits she’d be lost in real life without her husband’s computer expertise. 
“I was a Luddite for many, many years. My husband is really good with technology and eventually I got really sick of asking him how to do everything,” she confesses. 
“So I started to pay attention and he explained to me how it works. Now I’m definitely more adept than I was.” Actor Anne Hathaway and husband Adam Shulman. Picture: Michael Loccisano/Getty Images. Anne Hathaway and Robert De Niro in a scene from the film The Intern. Picture: Roadshow Pictures Anne Hathaway knows how to work it on the red carpet. Picture: Ben Stansall / AFP Photo Anne Hathaway has come a long way from playing a dorky girl in Princess Diaries. Anne Hathaway looking gorgeous at the premiere of "The Intern" at the Ziegfeld Theatre in New York. Picture: Evan Agostini/Invision/AP Anne Hathaway attending the after party for the screening of "The Intern" in New York. 1 of n 
The husband in question is actor/jewellery designer Adam Shulman and, three years into their marriage, she clearly remains utterly enamoured of him. 
“He’s very smart and wise and has a lot of parity about things. He is number one on my list of people I go to for advice. I’m so lucky. Considering he’s only a couple of years older than me, he’s very grounded and I am very comfortable to go to him for anything.” 
Hathaway says she is also fortunate to have a large and diverse group of friends. Other Stories
